title: Amizing tool. There are no other words. Please ...
body: Amizing tool. There are no other words. Please read the instruction manual before using, that way you don't get to damage yor knives and claim that tool dont work.

title: Four Stars
body: It does the job quickly. I only wish the guard/guide was easier to change.

title: So easy even a woman can use it...
body: Just like  you reading this I looked here at some of the 1200 views trying to decide if this was worth it. It has  been on my want list for over 2yrs, but this year my wife took care of that and this morning  got me it for Christmas. I'm in awe of how freaking well this works and pissed I didn't do it sooner. Being able to put an edge on manually in the field is a great skill to have. One that I have learned over many years but, to my fellow woodsman, hunter's, and bushcrafter's there is no way even if you're Ray Mears could you throw a literally shaving sharp edge on a butter knife in a few minutes.. yes I did it just like the YouTube video it's no joke. A good video for proper  use is the one done by Boker knives it's in German but it shows the right placement and draw speed. Truly a great investment for your workshop/mancave.. seriously so easy even a woman could do it.... the only con right now is there is no guide for the scandi grinds like many of us have on our mora knives but I'll figure it out.. I already figured out how to do my TBT-1 and that's saying something.

title: Glad I took the plunge.
body: After a lot of research , I bought the original WSKTS. Follow the instructions and you will be happy with the results. With a little bit of practice , your knives will be really sharp. It works !!

title: Four Stars
body: So far works great.

title: Great for knives!
body: We bought this for the main purpose of sharpening lawn mower blades (we run a lawn service), and it is fast at getting them sharpened a little but it only conforms to the two outside angles and it ends up being sharp but not as sharp as I'd like.  It also isn't meant for heavy duty use and is only recommended that it be used for only 20 minutes straight.  On the plus side my knives have never been sharper!  I give it a three because it didn't satisfy me for sharpening mower blades.

title: I can do it
body: Finally, after years of trying, I can finally sharpen a knife.  I have lots of other sharpeners and never really succeeded in getting a sharp knife.  This product is easy and intuitive.  Not perfect.  I suspect that an expert can get them sharper but it works for me.  The knives are way sharper than I am used to - I have the finger cuts to prove it. Yeaaaa

title: This is the real deal!!!
body: I received my work sharp this morning. And it's the best sharpener I've ever had, hands down.. And I own dmt diamond stones, wet stones, ceramic, I've even got a 150.00  chefs choice. and as far as i'm concerned none of em can hold a candle  to this work sharp!!  I will never have to ever look at another sharpening system again. Today I know I've sharpened at least 50 knifes, all the wife's kitchen knifes, all my personal high $$$ knifes, A tomahawk, And only had to use one each of the belts, and they are still along way from being used up. I can't say enough about this product.Just read the book and use a little common brain power and you will be on your way............  Thanks work sharp and amazon  Pitbullman

title: Five Stars
body: Excellent sharpener

title: 8 Good, 1 bad.
body: Most good, one bad. This little machine is a very effective means of sharpening a blade, quickly and will put a very good convex edge on a knife. It is easier than other sharpening systems as the guide gives you the correct angle, and you don't have to maintain it by eye and feel. It comes with two guides, a 50 (25/25) for outdoor knvies and a 40 (20/20) for kitchen knives. The difference besides the angle is that the guide slot itself is narrower for kitchen knives. An optional guide of 40(20/20) for larger outdoor knives is also offered. In concept more acute angles could be offered by additional guides but I guess that would infringe on the market for the Deluxe version (Ken Onion) of this sharpener.This sharpener, using the 3 grit belts, especially at 20 degrees will produce a very very sharp edge, If you are inclinedto strop it with compound afterwards it will be even sharper. The one drawback, is that it is VERY easy to round off the tipof your knife. This is a risk that goes with any kind of power grinder, not just this machine. But I dropped a star because there is no caution or information on the box or instructional DVD about this. In fact, if you continue to sharpen knives exactly as in the DVD, you will eventually run into the tip problem. Users have determined that lefting the tip off when halfway across the belt resolves this problem. But it would be nice if the manufacturer examined and addressed this issue.Since I bought this unit I have sharpened 8 knives. And ruined the tip on one.

title: Makes you a pro!
body: I was tired of the old school cheap hand sharpeners. I do not have the skill of the professional sharpeners so this was best for me. Out of the box set up was easy. I used it on a new set of kitchen knives and loved the finished product.

title: stay Sharp Boys
body: believe me, I've tried every knife sharpening device out there. This one beats them all, hands down. It's a bit pricey, however once you've used it just once, you'll see that it's worth every single penny! I like it so much, I was showing my son how it worked and he said he was going to buy one, which spoiled my Christmas present to him. I had to tell him that I was buying him one for Christmas, also !

title: For me, it is just okay...it takes some serious practice
body: For sharpening my axe and hatchet with the 80 grit course belt...it was great.For my kitchen and hunting knifes...just OK for me.  First of all...going from 80 to 220 then jumping up to 5000 grit doesn't make that much sense to me.  I wish there was a 1200 grit belt for knifes.Second...BEWARE of taking off the point of your knifes.  I read about this and saw the You Tube postings and I STILL took off a couple of points...and I was careful, but obviously not careful enough.  :-(The Work Sharp will put a convex edge on your knives.  The edge I obtained was simply OK, but not as razor sharp as I hoped.

title: Knives are super sharp!
body: My husband LOVES it!  Knives are super sharp!

title: but it can do a good job sharpening knives
body: It has a learning curve to using the worksharp, but it can do a good job sharpening knives. The newer the belts the better, my Case Sodbuster is like a razor after just a couple of minutes. Much faster and easier than using sharpening stones or rods.

title: WSKTS Sharpener
body: Easy to use, quick change over and belt swap is easy.I sharpened my wife's entire knife block in less that 5 minutes (12 knives).Next task will be sharpening mower blades once I figure out how to get them off the mower!Great product backed and shipped by responsive helpful people.  You can't go wrong as far as I am concerned.

title: DAMN, thats sharp!!!!!
body: This thing is awesome! Ive never had the patience to use stones to sharpen my knives. The work sharp makes what used to be a frustrating chore into a fast and sure way to get a razor edge. Thete is a small learning curve, just read the intsructions and pay attention to what your doing

title: Best knife sharpener
body: The Work Sharp is easily the best knife sharpener I have ever tried.  I think I own every sharpener built and all of then require you to hold an exact angle, while moving the knive over some sort of abrasive. The Work Sharp pre sets the angle and the abrasive belt moves on its own, so the blade is always at the correct angle.. All of my knives are sharp and I have even taken it to friends homes and sharpened  their's as well.  Great product.  Ed B.

title: Work sharp sharpener
body: Wonderful!

title: It's for real!
body: I used to spend hours (of boredom) or lots of $ to sharpen my knives.  But now, in less than two minutes per knife, my knives shave the hair right off my arm.  Where has this thing been all my life??

title: Five Stars
body: Best price anywhere and great product.

title: WSKTS Work Sharp Kinife Sharpener
body: This product exceeded our expectations! A+++! Highly recommended! Sharpens our items in less than 30 secounds, like new! Saves time, and money!

title: Just Buy It!!!
body: I can't say enough good about this product! Reasonably priced and it's done everything I asked it to. Happy-happy-happy! Buy one today!

title: Simply the best!
body: I have been a professional meat cutter for 35 years and the Work Sharp is by far the easiest and fastest way to sharpen your knife. Very easy to use out of the box. Took me no more than five minutes to put a razor sharp edge on three of my knives. Highly recommened!!!

title: THE knife sharpener
body: I like this so well that I bought two to give last Christmas.  There are lots of knife sharpeners out there that claim to do a job.  This one actually sharpens my knives to a razor edge quickly.  Once they are initially sharpened it generally takes one or two passes in the sharpening jig and they're good for another month.  This is the best knife sharpener I've ever seen.

title: Excellent
body: Excellent product. Best knife sharpener on the market.

title: Five Stars
body: Works great!

title: Best, easiest and fastest knife sharpener I've tried yet.
body: I bought this primarily to sharpen kitchen knives and hunting knives. I've tried a few other sharpeners in the past, and none have worked as well, or as fast as this one. Takes a little practice holding the knife against the gude while drawing through, but once you have your technique down you can quickly sharpen a dull knife to a razor edge in less than a minute. Once the knives are sharp, the finer honing belt works well to keep them that way. Belt change is quick and easy as well. With this sharpener I can now sharpen knives faster than my wife can dull them!

title: Knife Sharpner
body: I heard about this knife sharpner through a fishing friend who owned one.  It is like no sharpner I've ever had before.  It will sharpen anything that has a edge.  My wife even likes it.

title: Five Stars
body: very good

title: Worth the buy!
body: Works just like the advertisement shows. Simple and easy! I got this from my wife as an anniversary present and have since recommended it to others.

title: Fabulous
body: I've never been very good at sharpening knives.  This is so easy even I can do it AND they are sharp, really sharp. It is so nice having sharp knives in the kitchen and even my pocket knife is back to being useful again.  I just wish I had bought this years ago.

title: Three Stars
body: Really gets the job done, and fast.

title: this is the sharpping tool you want if you like your knives like a shaver blade
body: Yeah, this is the sharpping tool you want if you like your knives like a shaver blade. Amazing!

title: I've tried multiple sharpeners and this one is my favorite so far
body: I've tried multiple sharpeners and this one is my favorite so far. I am still learning on how not to round the tip and the 20 percent angle guide doesn't work with some of my folders (I like 20 percent on my full flat grind blades with VG10 steel or other comparable steels). 4 stars!

title: Really works and easy to use
body: I finally took our new WSKTS for a spin this weekend and ended up sharpening everything I could get my hands on, including half a dozen kitchen knives and our household scissors. The unit was very easy to use and the instruction booklet was easy to follow. The sanding belts held up very well, I expect to be able to use them again for some time. I was very impressed the results, my knives are now quite sharp and the sharpener did not leave visible marks or scarring on the blades. During operation the machine was easy too hold, not very noisy and I did not create any sparks or flying shards of metal.

title: Finally a sharpener that works
body: After years and many dollars spent on inferior knife sharpeners, we have one that works fantastically well.  We highly recommend this product.  We have used it for knives and scissors.  Have not yet tried it on tools.

title: Best Sharpener device I've ever owned
body: I have used many tried and true methods to sharpen my sharpen my hunting and kitchen knoves and tools.  I discovered that for those knives requiring simple resharpenening the Work Sharp is fast and very easy to use.  It puts an extremely fine edge of the blade.  It also works great for initial sharpening as well.  I normally carry several knives in my pack in case one becomes dull...this year I used one hunting knive to process three deer.....and I could have usd it again if neded.  It also works great on touching up kitchen knives.  The ability to use it on straight and serrated blades makes it a one stop tool.  I highly recommend the Work Sharp WSKTS knife and Tool Sharpener.....it will be the last knife and tool sharpening tool you buy.

title: Work Sharp Knife and Tool Sharpener
body: Great kitchen knife sharpener!  Easy to use and the directions are easy to follow.  The belts are easy to change and the results are amazing.

title: Sharp Knives
body: Wow, this works great.  I did sharpen two cheap knives first to get a hang of it.  I'll tell you what, those cheap knives are now sharp enough to shave the hair off of my arms.  After my practice runs, I sharpened all my Henkels.  They are now better than new.  Sharp as all get out (my arms are as smooth as a baby's bottom from all the testing)NO OIL,QUICK,EASY TO LEARNAlso sharpened my kitchen scissors.

title: Tools and Knives !
body: Manual sharpening of our knives and garden tools are out of the picture. It is a very good product. I  sure do recommend it to my friends and associates. Thank you !

title: Five Stars
body: best out there.

title: wskts sharpner
body: This is the best sharpener out there that I've found. I've tried a number of them and never could get the edge I wanted on a hunting knife. This one is on my work bench. The others are in a cabinet or discarded. I would recommend this to anyone I know.

title: I love this sharpener
body: It works great. this sharpener is  so easy to use, any clown (by any clown, I mean me) can get a great edge that I couldn't get without a lot of work before.  I have a razor edge on a knife in just a few seconds. I've only had it a few weeks but I'm super happy.

title: This is one of the best tools on the earth
body: This is one of the best tools on the earth!!  It truly sharpens any knife or pair of scissors in the house.  I would recommend it to every household.

title: I can finally sharpen my own knives
body: I've never been good or patient at using a stone or other sharpeners.  This made quick work of every knife I have in the house.  Great for pocket and outdoor knives.

title: Five Stars
body: Its amazing very easy to use and saves allot of time get ready for razor sharp knives

title: Knife sharpening made simple
body: I like my knives sharp and that would normally require at least 15 minutes per knife.  With this product, it takes a minute so sharpen and another minute to polish an 8' knife, which helps it 'glide' through the material being cut.  I've sharpen roughly 30 knives, big and small, and still on the same set of belts.  The medium grit belt is wearing out, because I used it the most.  I'd venture to say that it'll last another 10-20 more.  Overall, it's a very well-designed piece.  BTW, to make the belts last longer, try to avoid long 'sessions' which tend to heat up the backing and bonding material which would cause premature failure.

title: Great item
body: This is the only way to sharpen knives and small tools. The instructions are easy to understand and they include a DVD. I sharpened the kitchen knives in about a half hour and the wife loves them. I did my hunting knives but have not tried them yet. Compare to using a wet stone this is too easy. I think you could take it to hunting camp if you brought a inverter for the truck.

title: Nice product
body: Nice product.  I like how the belt is flexable and glides over the steel of a knife.  I also used it to sharpen my lawnmower blade.  I really liked that.  I was tired of the stones of knife sharpening.  This has a guide also for the knife that makes the pull of the knife easier than a stone pull. Come time to take the belt of is no problem, takes 4 seconds. Very Easy.  It just feels natural to sharpen the knife with this product. I sharpened the wife's kitchen knives, sissors and my super small pocket knife. They are really sharp.  With an electric stone sharpener, you can't see the stone against the knife whereas you can see the belt flex againt the blade of the knife with this product.  I don't know how long the belts last. It's a keeper.

title: Five Stars
body: It does an excellent job on many different knives and appropriate tools.

title: Shave Sharp in seconds.
body: What else is there? It will take the cheapest knife you have a put a shaving sharp edge on it, no questions asked. The cheapness of the knife just means it won't keep that edge.

title: Five Stars
body: Works great.

title: Four Stars
body: Exactly what I was looking for.

title: Customer service exists!
body: Please read the entire review. I bought the Work Sharp WSKTS in December of 2014. Love it. The belts are extremely easy to replace, the guides slip on easily and the results are exactly as advertised. In no time every knife in my kitchen were razor sharp. Unfortunately in March it quit working. Using past experiences as my guide I drug my feet before going down the warranty replacement road. This is the true test of a company's  metal. I went online to review the warranty process. I notice a "Chat" button so I thought what the heck, I'll give it a try. I was immediately greeted with a pleasant, grammatically correct (not that I am an English professor by any stretch of the imagination) response with correctly spelled words. I told her my problem and she quickly got me set up. In less than 2 weeks I had a new unit. Quick, painless and friendly. When I told her how impressed I was with the customer service she responded "Thank you. We are a small family owned company and we believe you should have a good quality item that lasts. I'm sorry you had a defect. We will get you back up and sharpening in no time." Despite best efforts things break. I understand that. It is how a company responds to these events that define them. I have this and a Work Sharp WS3000. I highly recommend both items and now that I know the integrity of the company I will look forward to my next purchase from them.

title: I don't have enough neighbors
body: First day, I sharpened everything that kinda had a blade on it. Second day, I sharpended all my families knives and bladed things. Thrid day I started in on the neighbors, but there are not enough of them.KInda kidding, but using this sharpener makes a person want to use tools just to sharpen them. Man, it works so well.I have had this kit for several months now, and keep finding new uses for it. Lots of things to do on the trucks and traliers because you can get the tool into small places and the belt conforms to the tool.

title: works great
body: Like any tool, it takes a while to get the hang of it, but the work sharp. Belts don't seem to last as long as work sharp claims

title: great
body: i didn't order this, it was charged to my account somehow not sure no one can tell me how. gave it away as a gift. love the product i have one of my own, i would recomend this to everyone that wants a sharp knife and easy to use.

title: work sharp wskts
body: This is the best sharpener I have ever used.  I've done a lot of skinning and butchering, so always need a razor sharp blade.  This tool will make it razor sharp with few passes. Works great as a grinder also. I wish I would have had something this small and easy to use while I was still farming and ranching.

title: Four Stars
body: Handy tool. Use it all the time

title: Five Stars
body: Works great and is easy to use.

title: pretty good results
body: bought this for a co-worker and he helped sharpen a couple of the folding pocket knives in the shop. My dull blade was bend and it still did a good job and it did the serrated part very sharp also.

title: Awesome Tool
body: after wasting time and money over the years with diamond sharpeners , sharpening stone kits and other stones . electrical and manual systems i became used to the poor sharpening performance of the other systems.   after viewing the WSKTS beign advertised in a tool magazine i became interested and did some researching . a few weeks after one of my stones broke and decided to get this system to find out how it worked.   well yesterday i got my package and 10 minutes after i had all my knives razor sharp! no joke, i shaved my arm with my pocket knives just to prove they were sharp .   i recomend this tool to anyone looking to get razor sharp blades. by the way my brother , 'who's a cook' will get one for his B-day

title: Awesome Product
body: Great product. Sharpens pretty much everything and does an excellent job at that. That includes kitchen knives, hunting knives, hatchets, etc.

title: my work sharp
body: I tried one at a family member. After I received it I sharpened all my dull knives .Worked perfect

title: Buy but beware of super sharp knives.
body: Sharpest knife sharpener in the box. Great product but you need to start pulling the knife before you start the machine

title: A cut above the rest
body: I received my wskts yesterday so I can't comment on the longterm reliability of the machine yet. After I received it yesterday I went crazy sharpening every knife in my home. The wskts is amazing in how easy it is to get a knife hair shaving sharp. If you register your product online they will send you a free 1 time pack of replacement belts. The thing I like about it is how easy it is to use. It sharpens kitchen knives and big thick outdoor knives just as easy as anything. I think this is a solid purchase and I would recommend this to a friend.

title: Five Stars
body: Simple and easy and best of all it works

title: VERY SATISFIED.
body: It does everything it's advertised to do. Just read the directions, and you are a pro! It's engineered to eliminate the mistakes most people make when sharpening a knife.

title: work sharp
body: I bought this in part because it was made in Oregon, where I live. It isn't as easy to keep the knife against the guide as they lead you to believe, especially to get the tip sharpened evenly. It works, but not the answer to all of your sharpening problems

title: Amazing Sharpener!
body: I have been using for over a year now and you get an amazing edge with this system, except on really weird shaped blades or a blade that is over 1/4 inch thick.

title: Easy to use and works as advertised
body: I have used this produce several times now. It works just like the video says it will. I have sharpened kitchen knives, serrated knives and scissors. I bought another one for my son-in-law.

title: Hell of a sharpener.
body: This thing works, Keep that in mind because the knives that you sharpen with this Work Sharp sharpener will become really dangerous ! I didn't read any instructions, I just dug up a bunch of old, dull knives and started practicing..within 15 minutes I had no more arm hair, I had cut  myself 3 or 4 times, and there were no more big pieces of paper remaining anywhere near where I was sharpening. I had tried all kinds of other sharpeners, but never really had good results...( because I'm really impatient and a half-ass ) The Work Sharp sharpens everything super quickly, even if you're not very good at sharpening things. ONE thing to be careful about though...the tips of all my knives have become pseudo-tanto points..( I should not have cut up the instructions...) But the kit comes with a dvd, and you can register your tool online and get some free belts sent via mail...Awesome company and awesome tool !

title: Works Great
body: My Wife gave me this knife sharper for a Christmas Gift. I was completely surprised  at how Great it worked,  but it gets all of my knives razor sharp!

title: great
body: was a wonderful price and a wonderful item.  sharpened all our house knives and what a great job it did.

title: Blown away!
body: WOw and WOW! Bought a new kershaw knife with the expensive blade. It was so hard I could not get it sharp. Then I found the worksharp WSKTS-1 knife sharpener and I was blown away! I used the red band, then switched to the purple and it was shaving hair off my arm after 2 passes! QUiet and the absolute most effective sharpener I have ever owned.  This will be a awesome christmas present!The video made perfect sense. So make sure you watch it. Just use the attachment that is correct for kitchen knife vs. outdoor knife and you are set! I sharpened the entire house set in minutes. An entire set as fast as it takes to do one knife the old way! Extremely worth the investment!

title: Five Stars
body: This is the best knife sharpener ever!

title: Great product.
body: easy to use. I have tried all sorts of knife sharpeners and this one is by far the best of them all. Easy to set up, use and the results are fantastic. I sharpened 6 knives in less than 45 minutes. Would I recommend? Heck yes. Any one can use this.

title: GREAT KNIFE SHARPEN
body: i sharpened all my kitchen and pocket knive in one sitting.  Now I am doing the neighbors.It makes shapening so easy.

title: Outstanding Device
body: I have been frustrated for many years while attempting to sharpen my many knives. I am an avid outdoorsman and have a knife for every hunting and fishing adventure. The problem is keeping them sharp. The Work Sharp ended my frustrations. I can sharpen any type of cutting device that I own in must minutes. This device is simple but effective. I would recommend it to anyone.

title: Three Stars
body: it worked good for what I needed and for the price

title: Good for all types of edges
body: Works very well

title: Five Stars
body: Best sharper in the market.

title: Disappointed
body: I try not to get to excited about something because I'm sometimes disappointed as I was in this case, I was so excited when I saw the companies video about their product it is so simple to get the angle right I was excited, it's so easy even I can do it.  The sharpener creates a convex edge on what your sharpening, now for tools like lawn mower blades, axes and other tools like this that's fine but for my knives I didn't like that, it did sharpen them - quickly - and better than most sharpeners i've bought  you know the quick and inexpensive ones  and while i'll say that it did sharpen them , and again I love the idea with the angle guides, I really love that idea , however it didn't get them quite as sharp as I expected.  and that is where my disappointment comes from, conceptually I love the idea.  If I were ever able to make an improvement I'd add something behind the belt to make the convex angle subdued, the rounding on my knives was too much  too rounded. but for tools it's like axes  which have a rounded edge  it's great.  Another problem that I had is with serrated blades the idea is to flatten the back side , instead it rounded it.  I wish I had bought it from the company instead of amazon because they have a 30 day return policy with amazon you can return it only if the item is unopened.  if you opened it that's too bad.  CONCLUSION  I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND IT FOR HUNTING KNIVES , nor  FOR THE FLAT BACKS OF SCISSORS.

title: Work Sharp WSKTS Knife & Tool Sharpener
body: This tool is very effective, the first sharpener that I have used that makes a perfect razor sharp edge on even the cheapest knife.

title: Great item and works pretty much as described
body: Great item and works pretty much as described.  The one thing I would want you to know is that it is not as great and easy as it is made to sound, but it is very easy and you can get a very sharp blade if you are careful and hold the knife properly throughout.

title: might scratch your blades
body: Great but the guides Will scratch you blades you can just put a stick strip of felt on them

title: Knife and Tool Sharpener
body: I bought this for my husband as a gift.  He loves it. He really enjoys sharpening any kind of knives.

title: Extremely noisy after only a few uses. Not able to achieve the same razor edge as hand sharpening with stones.
body: only sharpened a few knives and now it makes a terrible squealing sound like the bearings are shot. Never got a a knife super sharp  with this device, it put a decent edge on a blade but not the razor edge that I get from my spyderco sharpmaker. It puts a useful edge on a knife quickly and if it weren't for the terrible noise that is makes now I would still be using it.

title: excellent item
body: This is by far the best knife sharpener I have ever used.  Definitely recommend purchasing this tool.who doesn't love an obnoxiously sharp knife?

title: Last sharpener you'll need
body: Now that I've purchased and used this sharpener, I can get rid of the drawer full of sharpeners that can't come close to the edge work sharp puts on knives. I can't wait to try it on my mower blades. I highly recommend getting this. You will be happy you did

title: ... that the sharpening angles are the secret of a good sharpening. this equipment solved all my
body: took me years to understand that the sharpening angles are the secret of a good sharpening. this equipment solved all my problems

title: Five Stars
body: Excelent product, you can keep your tools and knives as they should be.

title: Great product!
body: This thing is great. It is easy to use and works as advertised. I have sharpened everything from my kitchen knives to my hatchets and machetes and I haven't been disappointed yet. I still like to sharpen my pocket knife with a stone because I like to but not because this sharpener doesn't work. When I registered the product, the company even sent me a free set of belts. Speaking of the belts, I'm still using my original belts and they are still doing their job. I hesitated before trying this sharpener because I've found most systems are not as versatile as they claim. This one is and doesn't require a lot of set-up or skill to get good results on a variety of blades, I even sharpened my shovel blades. Great item and company appears to be very customer oriented.

title: THUS FAR I WOULD BE INCLINED TO BUY ANOTHER ONE.
body: I'VE HAD THE SHARPENER FOR ABOUT 1 WEEK AND HAVE USED IT 3 TIMES ON DIFFERENT WORK SERVICES, I.E., POCKET KNIVES, HUNTING KNIVES AND SCISSORS.  UP TO NOW IT HAS FAR EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS. ALL OF THOSE ITEMS WERE SHARPENED TO A FINE HONE AND THEY CUT VERY WELL.  I DO NOT INTEND TO EVER ATTEMPT TO SHARPEN A LAWN MOWER BLADE WIH THE WORK SHARP BECAUSE I THINK IT MAY PUT TOO MUCH STRESS ON THAT EQUIPMENT.  I COULD BE WRONG BUT THAT IS MY PERSONAL CALL.  IT SEEMS TO HAVE BEEN WELL-DESIGNED AND IS SOMEWHAT EASY TO OPERATE AND THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE REASONABLY WELL PREPARED.  I WOULD NOT GIVE IT 5 STARS BUT PROBABLY A VERY HIGH 4 STARS.  ALSO, THE PRICE SEEMS TO BE ACCEPTABLE TO ME.

title: Five Stars
body: Love it

title: works great
body: Great for sharpening small tools scissors Knives axes etc.

title: OMG!!! Outstanding!! Most Magnificent Sharpening Tool Ever!!
body: Hello,    I bought this incredible WKTS sharpening machine over a month ago.  Then I bought the heavy duty carry bag for it right after, off of the WKTS maker website.  But I got a bit busy and hadn't even unboxed the sharpener yet until this morning.  Plus I had been trying to use hand stones, the diamond sharpening stones. Hours and hours of using those stones and still could never get my knives exactly to where I wanted them to be as far as sharp.  I have the heavy duty handmade and Cold Steel/ SOG type bowie and survival knives and already tried several electric sharpeners unsuccessfully. they were either too week to sharpen my heavy blades or my blades would not fit in the slots. So I have to say that I was a bit skeptical about using this machine, but I did buy it out of curiosity and out of strictly reading all the positive reviews.  But I was still sortof afraid to try it for fear of ruining my knives.  Finally last night after just being totally fed up with using the sharpening stones for hours and hours and getting basically Nowhere with them, I broke down unboxed the WKTS tool.  I read the instructions which were so very simple and easy.  I had also been worried that the instructions were all real detailed and everything, what with the tool looking like a real sophisticated tool. But the instructions on it were the easiest and simplest instructions I have ever read. I got the WKTS and the attachment for Outdoor Knives, attached it and plugged the tool in. Wow!! In an instant it had a professional high quality razor sharp edge on my Cold Steel Trail Master bowie knife.  The WKTS had the edge on that knife hair-shaving razor sharp within just a few strokes.  Then I got out my Outback Bowie knife. Bang!! in minutes the WKTS had that heavy blade's edge hair-shaving sharp. Then I went to my handmade survivl bowie knife and got that blade razor sharp. Then onto the other knives I have and have been mainly using, all handmade high quality knives. I have quite afe wmore knives to sharpen, but I mean to tell you that in just minutes the WKTS had 6 or 7 of my most favorite knives hair-shaving razor sharp!  I could really kick myself in the arse for not using my WKTS tool before now.  I would have really saved myself a lot of time and effort and a whole lot of hand and arm pulling use! The WKTS is the absolute best knife sharpening tool I have ever seen and now used! Instead of it being a boring chore, it was actually the most fun using it.  It was just a ton of fun to use.  Folks are not lying when they say that the WKTS tool turns boring dreadful knife sharpening, which could take hours to do, into a fun-packed and exciting thing. Plus, I don't know about other people, but it made me feel kind of 'Tall-type' proud that my knives are now razor sharo!  I highly recommend this WKTS tool to anyone and everyone who has, uses, and loves for their knives, blades, and scissors to be sharp. Using this tool sure leaves a lot of time to do other things! If you have been looking for a simple and easy way to sharpen all your knives and blades and scissors and other objects requiring sharpening, then look no further because the WKTS tool is just what you need. ! Thanks for reading!

title: Works as advertised
body: Just got mine out of the box and reprofiled the edge that the Smith PP-1 had destroyed on my [[ASIN:B000XAT8DC Columbia River Knife and Tool's 2125KV Ultima 5-Inch Razor Edge Fixed Blade Knife]]. Since this was a repair job, it took rather more passes through the guides than the instructions call for, but the result was an edge capable of easily shaving hair off my arm. More than sharp enough for the work I do with my outdoor knives, and very nice for finer work, as well.    The reason I give this product 4 stars instead of 5 is that the design isn't optimal for all styles of blade. My Ultima is a modified tanto-style, and the angle between the point section and the main blade ended up somewhat rounded. The guide also will give some difficulty  working with the very point on a tanto, so you're better off free-handing if you need the tip to be really sharp.    All in all, I'm quite pleased with the ease of use, and the results are admirable for the relatively low cost.

title: Razor Sharp
body: I can sharpen a knife nearly razor sharp by hand, good enough for me. With this tool I can make my knives extremely razor sharp in less than two minutes. Enough said!!!

title: Very Disappointed
body: I did lots of research before I bought this sharpener.  I read many of the highest and lowest reviews.  I watched every video I could find on youtube.  I got the sharpener today, read the instructions, watched the video and started sharpening.I took 8 passes on the medium grit.  The knife was really sharp, so I proceeded to the finest belt.  I got one complete pass before the front pulley locked up.  I took the belt off and the plastic pulley was completely frozen.  There was no way to move it or to disassemble the cassette.I have a belt sander and have used many different models.  I know how to center a belt.  This belt was centered and was moving freely before it all locked up.  I am sending it back for a refund.All my knives are still in need of a good sharpening so if anyone has a recommendation I would appreciate hearing it.

title: Genius!!!
body: Works Awesome!

title: Absolutely the best sharpener I have ever bought!
body: I would give this 10 stars if I could. This sharpener is the best and easiest I have ever used (besides a 1000-8000 grit whetstone). I followed the instructional DVD and I sharpened all of my kitchen knives to a razor sharp finish. I can cut meat with no problem and cutting produce, especially tomatoes, with ease. I already recommended this to other friends who have tried this sharpener on their hunting and skinning knives and they love it!

title: Love Sharpening Tool
body: I used this tool on our kitchen knives and my hunting knives. The angle produce a great sharp edge on both knives. I would recommend this tool to all my friends. Great product. Thanks to Work Sharp company.

title: Never a dull moment!!
body: This works great for kitchen and hunting knives. I field dress and butcher a lot of deer and it is great to have sharp knives without spending a hour with a bone trying to get a good edge, you just simply take 10 seconds with the Work Sharp and it is as sharp as new!!

title: Hog hunter

title: Good value for the money
body: I bought this for my husband and he loves it! He watched the video and has sharpened my Henkels easily. A great investment--should have bought it years ago!

title: The Easiest Way To Sharpen A Blade
body: If you have ever known that person who was able to sharpen a blade to perfection and could never figure out how they do this. Let me introduce you to the new WORK SHARP. This tool is a must have for any novice, and it's also a great buy for the people who know how to do it the old fashion way. I only say that cause I know a couple of people that can do it by hand but I would race anyone of them with the Work Sharp and do it in half the time. It's afordable, affective, and quallity built. The best part is replacement belts are cheap too. I was looking for a tool to recut the bevel on some blades that had been vary abused. I talked to a guy that was demoing this tool to the store personel cause they were going to start selling the Work Sharp. I told him if he could fix one of those blades I had I would be sold not only did he fix it but he did it in about 2 minutes flat. It's all history from then on. I went home and that night got online surched it out and have not had an issue with it.

title: It REALLY  works!
body: I bought this device yesterday, and today about 20 of my kitchen knives are razor sharp.  With a machine shop background, I was familiar with small '3 wheel belt sanders' - we used to sharpen shop tools with them 40 years ago!  Work sharp has essentially crossed a mini - belt sander with a mini electric chainsaw power head and 'Walla' - the Work Sharp Knife and Tool Sharpener!!! Well built, and with angle guides to make sharpening a snap, it is a great little tool.  One big advantage of this sharpener (over stones, wheels and other 'hard' sharpeners) is that the belt will FLEX.  That allows for contouring to a blade, and also prevents grinding off excessive metal. With three grades of abrasive belts, there is wide versatility for sharpening, grinding and honing.  The belts seem to be holding up very well, and can be swapped out in just a few seconds. Also of interest to me is that the 'belt head' can be rotated to several positions - allowing for standard sharpening, compact storage, and also use as a mini finishing / deburring tool!  Quite ingenious.

title: Fast ,sharp
body: Best sharpener I've used . I have the Spyderco Sharpmaker and a couple lansky type sharpeners and this is far quicker sharpening method . It will only do convex edge . Don't worry about it if you have a V edge it will sharpen it with a slight convex without hardly any material removal . It is very easy to use .it leaves a clean professional edge which is hair popping sharp .

title: Five Stars
body: great

title: F#%kin AWESOME!!!
body: This thing is f#%kin AWESOME!  I've always been a knife enthusiast, and own many high end knives.  Besides sharpening by hand, I've tried several sharpening systems, and while some of them work very well, this is by far the best I've ever used!  It takes only a minute or two per knife,  and the belts are really easy to change quickly.  It's actually so easy, it's enjoyable!  After I sharpened the folder and fixed blade knives that I carry daily to literally shaving sharp (seriously, i actually shaved with them!) I went nuts and sharpened the f#%k out of every knife in my house!  My girlfriend has cuts all over her hands from doing dishes because she's not used to them being that ridiculously sharp.  Then I snuck into my friend's house while he was at work and I sharpened all his knives.  Now he's got cuts all over his hands too!  He nearly amputated his thumb trying to peel an apple!  That's how f%^king sharp this thing will make your knives!!I'd definitely recommend this to a friend.  I guess maybe I should warn them first though.  ;-)

But this sharpener puts them all to shame and will get your blades scary sharp...enough so that you can shave with them.  The build quality of the machine itself is very good and, although it is fairly light, I know it will last for a very long time.  Although some day I will have to replace some of the sharpening belts, they have worked for me for over a year without need to buy new ones.  It does a good job on scissors too.

title: Five Stars

title: Great product even better customer service!
body: The machine works perfectly and is damn near fool proof, sharpens things quite quickly and thoroughly but watch out for overheating. I ground the edge onto 6 machetes with the 2 green (roughest) belts that it came with and finished em all off with the red (medium) and purple (fine) to get insanely sharp edges. Now, the customer service is what I was impressed by, go online and register your machine and the company actually sends you one more of each belt absolutely free!! If you want sharp knives/tools and don't have the insane skills required to do it by hand then this will be absolutely perfect for you as it was for me.

title: Finally a fast, easy and effective sharpener
body: I don't often write product reviews, but when they really hit a nerve with me, I gotta say something whether good or bad. And in this case, I finally found my knife sharpening nirvana. To back up for a moment, let me first say, I've been a seeker on the path of the fine edge since, well let's call it more than two decades now.   Dunno what it is, or why, but I've always valued a beautifully sharp knife. I bought Juranitch's Razor Edge book, I bought steels, and all kinds of manual sharpening tools. Achieving that beautiful sharpness, however, has been a somewhat elusive endeavor. Yeah, that's right until now! Don't get me wrong, I've done alright maintaining sharp knives, but grinding away on my Spyderco Triangle Sharpmaker, for example, just got to be too much work. And for really dull knives, I finally broke down and bought the diamond rods hoping to speed up the process a bit. Forget it! I'm selling that system now, b/c I'll NEVER go back to scraping steel over ceramic. This belt sanding method is just sooooooo much quicker, easier, and I'm getting edges now that are way nicer than I've ever been able to achieve with my ceramics.  One caveat, it is a belt sander and so it's easy to round off the tip or change the lines if you're not careful... practice on some not so precious knives first! But once you get the hang of it, it's no longer a chore to get shaving sharp knives and tools. Yeah, my shovels, clippers, axes, chisels, everything's sharp now! One thing I'll add is that I also really like using a Surgi Sharp leather belt on my Delta belt sander. The combination of the two makes knife sharpening a joy instead of a job.

title: Outstanding Sharpening System
body: It took a little practice holding the knife against the guide correctly.  However, even with less than perfect technique the knives were razor sharp.  Very impressive.  I have always struggled to get a good edge on a knife and this is by far the easiest and best result that I have ever gotten.  I sharpened all our kitchen knives and within 24 hours all three of us in the family had gotten cut in one way or another.  Word of caution, you have to get used to working with sharp knives.  I had a small very cheap Chinese folder that I carry.  I was able to get this shaving sharp.  It has been used on a daily basis around the house and Garage.  It has held is edge quite well even being very cheap metal.  I really love the convex edge this puts on your knives.  I am usually not overly impressed with products, however, this one is very impressive and I would recommend this to anyone.

title: Great Little Machine
body: Received this little wonder yesterday. It seems to be very well made. I took it out to my shop, and within minutes was sharpening like a pro! My wife is a Great cook and I took all of her Knives and Cleavers out and sharpened all of them to a razor's edge. Now the little woman is so happy I'll be eating like a King for the forseeable future. Do yourselves a favor fellas, if your wife likes her knives sharp, you can't go wrong with the Worksharp. The only minor drawback is the tool gets hot pretty quickly, so take frequent breaks to allow it to cool. Also don't press down on the blade, you don't need to, just guide it smoothly through and the Machine will do all the work. And be careful you don't cut yourself on your now razor sharp cutlery. This thing makes your knives 'Martin Yan sharp' Also great for hunters and gardeners as you can sharpen pretty much anything with this tool.

body: I watched the manufacturer's video on this product and in a weak moment I ordered one as the Amazon price was very competitive. It is great for sharpening kitchen and scissors (all I have attempted so far) and sharpens quickly and efficiently. It is very intuitive to use and takes little time to learn the correct technique. The manufacturer posts a number of how-to videos on their website as well. I am happy with this purchase and would recommend it to family and friends.

title: World of sharpness
body: I got this device and started sharpening everything in the house. knives, scissors, machete's you name it. If it had an edge it got sharpened. My wife which is left handed and 'NOT' very agile, has tried various devices to sharpen things and has failed. I got her to try this one and she can now sharpen a knife. 'I'm so proud of her little achievements' Great device and worth it's weight in gold.

title: Mostly works great
body: This is one of the best knife sharpeners I've ever used. It doesn't get edges as sharp as my DMT stones and strop, but it comes close and in far less time. Something that might take me 30 minutes on the stones only takes 2 minutes with the Work Sharp. My only complaint (and it might be my own fault) is the bevels on all my knives are steeper on one side. It doesn't affect cutting performance though, my formerly blunt Becker BK9 can now easily slice a sheet of printer paper in half with one stroke.

title: Work Sharp does it again.
body: I recently purchased the Work Sharp knife sharpener after being so pleased with their WS3000 sharpener.  I've tried other means of sharpening knives; crock sticks, stones, etc. but his is by far the easiest and most productive.  Out of the box and with a quick glance of the instructions I was ready to use it.  The result: Knives will shave off the hair on your arm after you are through.  In one evening, between commercials, you too can sharpen all the kitchen knives on the rack.  The only down size is that it doesn't come in some sort of case or heavy bag for storage purposes.

title: Superior sharpener
body: Everyone wants some tool that can sharpen knives and this one does a great job.  However, seldom is there a tool that allows you to sharpen garden tools and other things around the house.  I use mine for yard tools and love it.  If you use it for knives, be careful not to leave it in contact with the belt too long.  It will grind away the blade if you are not paying attention.  I sharpened a small Swiss Army Knife and it took about 5 seconds or less per side.  Less is more.  I like the ease of changing belts to sharpen things like hatchets, axes and shovels.  Works great.

title: Great sharpener. Fast
body: Great sharpener.  Fast, light, acuucurate, and easy to use.  The instructions are very good and the tool paid for itself many times over in the last year and I'm still on the same belt.

body: Really like this knife sharpener for sharpening knives but, in my opinion it does not put a finished razor sharp edge on. But, with a ceramic stone and this system you can sharpen a very dull knife to new condition in a quarter of the time it would take you with hand stones alone.

title: Superb sharpening! A must have for every knife owner.
body: This little sharpening tool is the very best investment I have ever made. I'm a knife collector and it'll sharpen just about anything I own. From filet knives, to machete,axes,folding knives to garden tools! You name it it sharpens in minutes. It provides a video of steps to a successful sharpening. Super easy to use.You can even watch other people demonstrate it on YouTube. I love it.

title: Five Stars

title: worth the money
body: This is a great tool . puts a good edge  on hard to sharpen cheap knives and a great edge on good ones

title: Excellent sharpener!
body: First off let me say that I usually sharpen using stones freehand, however when it comes to sharpening you work knife that you know is going to get chipped, dulled, and destroyed, freehand sharpening seems to take far too long and far too often!  Sooo...I got this beauty and it literally took 5 mins to open the box, whip out a dull knife, and sharpen it to a keen edge using this machine!  It's not a perfect precision sharpening solution, and I would not recommend  it for use on any expensive knives, but for edc's and kitchen knives it can't be beat for speed and ease of use.  Pluses:  - It's fast!  - Get's a nice edge, not scary sharp, not 11 degree mirror polished bevel that can perform samurai sharpness tests, but a still polished edge that can shave hair and will handle all your everyday practical cutting needs.  - Simple to use.  In fact don't even bother to look at the instructions, I've heard they suck anyway.  Just open the box(the starting belt's already on the thing), slide the guide on, turn it on, and quickly(about 1 sec) draw your knife through keeping the knife against the guide.  Alternate this motion on both sides until it's sharp(5-7 passes on both sides),then repeat with the fine belt(which is super easy to change). That's it, you're done, it took a whole 5-8 mins, now you have time to sharpen that kitchen knife, maybe sharpen your friends knives, or maybe even raise your arms out and bask in your own super-egocentric glory from your recent acheivment, it's really up to you.  -Stropping after using this is the shnaaz!(that's obviously what the cool kids say)  -Not as loud as you would think.  It sounds about as loud as a cordless drill.  -It says that it's made in the USA.(If that matters to you)  Minuses:  - Not for high end knives since you could round the tip if you are not careful, and let's face it, if you have an expensive knife you are not going to want a 20-25 degree edge, you're going to want to sharpen and strop it at a very acute angle until you can pretend that you're a surgeon and you're knife is an elaborate scalpel.  - Green coarse belt is basically a bench grinder and will heat the blade up to fast to avoid ruining the temper to actually use.  However the red belt cuts more than fast enough and temper destruction should not be a problem unless you are going very slow.  - Gets hot quick, but again it only takes a short time to sharpen your knives so this shouldn't be a problem unless you are sharpening 6 or more knives in a row.  Judgement:  -Excellent sharpener for newbies or for those quick sharpening jobs!

title: Really works as advertised!! Got to be careful ...
body: Really works as advertised!!  Got to be careful though cause you can really remove some steel with that thing!!!

title: Five Stars
body: Works great and sharpens all knives.

title: Just like a lot of you out there
body: So.... Just like a lot of you out there, I too watched a few videos and read a lot of reviews before purchasing this product.  With that in mind, I felt like I had a good grasp on how to properly use the tool.  When I received it from SharpenerSupplies.com, I was very impressed.  I immediately took my cheapest knife and put an edge on it that not even my most expensive knives have.  Did the paper test...Check.  Did the arm hair test....Check.  Now... on to the facial hair.  Sure enough I can shave with my pocket knife.  (For those of you saying you can't get your blade facial hair razor sharp,  that's your fault, and not the tools fault. I was able to accomplish this with several of my knives. My kitchen knives now will shave a the fuzz off of a peach.  I have noticed the fine/honing belt has a short life span. However, once it is no longer abrasive, you can take a metal polish and apply to it making it somewhat of a 7000 - 8000 grit.  Which will make your knives like a scalpel. I highly suggest keeping the old worn out belt and doing this if you truly want that Scary Sharp edge that shines like chrome.  There is a learning curve with this tool, and if you aren't careful, you will round the tip of the blade off.  FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS to avoid this.  That's why they were written and included in the box.  Be sure to practice first with a cheap knife you do not care too much for.  That way you can get the feel for how much pressure, when to stop, and how fast to pull through.  Within 10 minutes, you should have the hang of it and be able to get that razor edge you desire with no trouble.  Overall I would highly recommend this product to any knife enthusiast, hunter, or outdoors-man.  Great product.  Great customer service.  Well worth the small investment.

title: This thing is great..
body: This thing is great...I was able to sharpen not only knives, I was able to smoothen out chips and knicks on blades, screwdrivers, chisels, and many other items.

title: Five Stars
body: It's a very good tool and the easy use

title: From butter knife to surgical instrument
body: Let me start by saying I have tried almost every knife sharpening tool there is, and I always get the same result, a knife that resembles more of a butter knife than an actual outdoor/everyday use tool. I sharpened both my kershaw Cryo knife, along with a homemade hunting knife, with good to great results. The tool is easy to use, but do yourself a favor and read the directions first!! It easily in around 5-10 minutes a blade got both knives to paper cutting/hair shaving sharp. The only downside, hence the four stars, is that it cannot sharped all the way down the blade of my Kershaw because the blade stops are in the way of the blade guard, not a huge deal to me, especially since I modded the blade so that my finger can extend past the flipper, so I never sharpened that part of the blade anyways. Now onto the the method in which the tool sharpens the blades, most will complain that it ruins the temper, I would argue that they are very wrong. To get the blade up to the temper that would ruin the temper you wouldn't be able to even touch the knife, so that is my simple solution, after every pass place the blade on the back of your hand, if it isn't hot to you, then the temper will surely be fine. I will continue to use the knife sharpener and love it every time.

title: Delivers
body: Simply stated...  You want sharp gear with minimum effort get this Work Sharp.I have nothing bad to say about this product.Checkout the videos on youtube for details on use.  It looks very simple because it is.

title: Sharpens everything
body: This sharpener will shapen knives, tools, siccors, lawnmower blades, you names it. Great investment to keep all your things sharp.

title: Better than I could ever do by hand
body: Bought this thing after years of attempting to keep my blades sharp bur could never  developed the proper technique. This thing takes all the guesswork out and gives me a razor edge. The best part is that it works on knives and tools so I dont need a seperate sharpener for different jobs

title: Pure Sharpening Awesomeness!
body: I ordered this bad boy on Sept 18 and it arrived early this morning (Amazon Prime is awesome!) As soon as I had a break from work, I took it out of the box and looked around for something to sharpen. What I found really put the Work Sharp to the test. I opened my desk drawer and remembered I had a cheap pair of 'Humvee' bowie knives that I use as practice throwers. They have been put through the ringer and since they were used for throwing knives, the blade sharpness was never that important. I pulled out the smaller of the two and felt over the blade. It was rounded and so dull it would have had difficulty slicing room temperature butter. I'm not kidding! (Ok, maybe a slight exaggeration, but not by much.)Setup was pretty straight forward and within a couple minutes I was ready to get to sharpening.Using their 20 degree guide and the green belt (the most course) I made six or eight swipes per side. Then I moved to the red belt (less course) and did six more. Finally, I switched to the lavender belt and went with four more swipes each side. Within two minutes, the blade went from duller than a 2x4 to shaving the hair off my arm with no drag what so ever.I can't wait to get home and sharpen all (yes ALL) of my knives!!

title: Just what I was looking for
body: Before owning this, I had a Spyderco Sharpmaker which was ok but wasn't great.  There was still that human element of trying to swipe the blade straight downward which wasn't always easy for me.  Also, it took a while to reprofile some blade with different angle grinds.  I even messed up a couple blades with it due to my human error.I got this after the Sharpmaker was lost and I'm glad I went with this.  Wasn't quite sure about the convex edge at first but it cuts quite well.  Not amazingly razor edge sharp like you can get with a Wicked Edge which costs $350-500 depending on the kit purchased but I wasn't about to spend that much money so I went with this.  It performs pretty dam good for the money paid for it and of course since its basically a mini belt sander its the fastest knife sharpener I have.  I sharpened and reprofiled just about all my folding knives and kitchen knives in record time.I also like the versatility to use it on large tools like axes and shovels.I'm not a guy with a ton of patience so the fact that this machine is quick and impressively sharp for its price is quite the win for me.Previous sharpeners no longer used:-  Spyderco Sharpmaker = B-  Edge Pro (Apex?), Chinese knockoff = B  (original may be better with their stones but the concentration needed to press and hold the blade down with one hand without ruining edge was irritating)-  Lansky sharpener (4-5 different colored stones...similar to Edgepro Apex) = C  (I just didn't like this tool.  Even the Chinese knockoff of the Edge Pro felt and performed better than this.  Of course, I didn't want to get good at it since I disliked it from the beginning.)

title: GREAT SHARPENER FOR EVERYTHING
body: This is one of the simplest sharpeners I have ever used. If you read and follow the directions from manual, I believe anyone could get a great edge on their knives, scissors, and other tools. I couldn't wait to sharpen my hunting knives, as soon as it arrived I read the directions and proceded to sharpen all of my knives the results were great, razor sharp edge on all of them again. This is a great product from a great company and also 'MADE IN THE USA' by americans.[[ASIN:B003IT5F14 Work Sharp WSKTS Knife and Tool Sharpener]]

title: Work Sharp works amazing!
body: Bought this one as a gift for my brother in law, after having mine for a year and absolutely loving it. Less than 5 minutes gets your knives as sharp as they day you bought them. Nice investment!

title: Best knife sharpener ever had!
body: I was skeptical before I order it.Boy oh boy. This thing sharpen knife not just fast but razor sharp.key of sharpning is using medium belt firstCheck edge of knife often, make sure evenly sharpened.After that using horning belt to achieve razor sharpness.I prefer spend more time to using horning belt than medium/corse belt. Because when it comes down to sharpning knife is how to make clean edge.

title: best sharpener around
body: Great tool works as described I'm a butcher keeps my works knives very very sharp and takes no time at all to get them that waybest

title: works great
body: First sharpener that worked as well as the ads say it would.

title: Five Stars
body: Delivered on time and performs as described.
